disease: Basal cell carcinoma of skin of left eyelid, including canthus

symptoms.name: Lesion on left lower eyelid
symptoms.pattern: Present for 2 years, occasional inflammation and healing, no change in size

physical_findings: Slowly enlarging ulceration with raised, pearly borders (classic presentation)
Involvement of medial canthus (often more deeply invasive)

In one case, loss of substance with destruction of the eye's inner canthus, lacrimal apparatus and medial half of the left lower eyelid; periorbital fat invasion; intimate contact with anterior lower boundary and extrinsic muscles of the eye (right medial, inferior and oblique inferior); no bone infiltration

CT scan: In one case, pathological tissue along the edge of the left lower orbital, invading periorbital fat; intimate contact with anterior lower boundary and extrinsic muscles of the eye (right medial, inferior and oblique inferior); no bone infiltration

required: Biopsy showing cohesive nests of cells with bland-appearing nuclei and nuclear palisading of the peripheral cell layer
supportive: Slowly enlarging ulceration with raised, pearly borders
Location on lower eyelid, medial canthus
